author: Kate Nuechterlein
title: Vaccination rates across Virginia drop slightly from last year
text:
CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va. (WVIR) - The number of people receiving the flu vaccine has decreased slightly this year compared to last.
As of December 7, the number of vaccinated children between six months old to 17 years old, has decreased from 51.5% last year to around 48.7% this year.
Only 14.7% of people aged 18 to 30 have received the flu vaccine.
The Virginia Department of Health says these numbers are only preliminary, and it does not know what is causing the decline.
‚ÄúWe are seeing a decrease but again it‚Äôs not a cause for alarm as of right now, but we are continuing to watch trends,‚Äù said Erica Hunter, the Immunization Data and Outreach Manager at the Department.
Hunter reminds people that there is one more walk-in flu clinic at the Charlottesville-Albemarle Health Department on Monday, December 23.
Do you have a story idea? Send us your news tip here .

author: ANI
title: At least 100 flights delayed due to fog at Delhi airport | Headlines
text: At least 100 flights delayed due to fog at Delhi airport At least 100 flights were delayed and a few were canceled due to low visibility at the Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi on Friday. [ANI](/ani-stories)| Updated: 29-12-2023 10:19 IST | Created: 29-12-2023 10:19 IST - Country: - India At least 100 flights were delayed and a few were canceled due to low visibility at the Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi on Friday. Airlines have requested passengers to keep a check on the status of flights on airline websites before leaving for the airport. Passengers who arrived at the airport but were not aware of the delays were seen sitting on the floors and waiting for an update from the airline. "I have been waiting for 12 hours at T-3 in the cold to catch a flight to Sharjah. The airline made no arrangements for passengers in case of delay in such weather," said Fakrool, a native of Rampur in UP. According to airport sources, visibility on Friday fell to 150 meters, which is considered moderate for flight operations. "No diversions have been reported till 8 am on Friday. There were several delays due to the weather and other conditions," as per sources. "I have a flight to Toronto, and it is delayed. I arrived at the airport in the morning from Punjab, and I am waiting for the update from the airline," said a passenger Kuldeep Singh, who was waiting with his family at IGI airport. Meanwhile, long queues of passengers at the entry gates of the Terminal were also seen. (ANI) (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)

title: Basket : L'Asvel l'emporte sur l'Alba Berlin apr√®s prolongation en Euroligue
text:
L'Asvel a repris des couleurs en Euroligue, deux jours apr√®s sa d√©route face au Partizan Belgrade (62-93), en disposant ce jeudi soir, √† l'Astroballe, de l'Alba Berlin. Non sans mal, puisque les joueurs de Pierric Poupet ont √©t√© pouss√©s en prolongation (96-89, 85-85 √† la fin du temps r√©glementaire) par la formation allemande, qui avait remport√© l'une de ses trois seules victoires face √† l'Asvel √† l'aller (84-79 le 15 octobre).
L'√âQUIPE Toujours priv√©s de Joffrey Lauvergne (mollet), en plus de Charles Kahudi et Mbaye Ndiaye (ligaments crois√©s), les Villeurbannais se sont d√©tach√©s au d√©but du deuxi√®me quart-temps en infligeant un 11-0 aux Berlinois, d√©pass√©s par l'adresse √† trois points d'Edwin Jackson (4/5, 18 points au total).

Avant de voir la formation emmen√©e par l'arri√®re am√©ricain Matt Thomas (20 points, 4/9 √† trois points) combler peu √† peu son retard, jusqu'√† √©galiser √† 7 secondes du buzzer sur un tir prim√© de Malte Delow (85-85), qui ne convertissait pas le lancer franc obtenu sur une faute de Nando De Colo (10 points, 2 rebonds, 7 passes).
L'Asvel reprenait l'avantage d√®s le d√©but de la prolongation (91-85), pour arracher une dixi√®me victoire en Euroligue cette saison (12 d√©faites) avant de recevoir Barcelone vendredi prochain.

author: Noticias RCN
title: Varios heridos tras la detonaci√≥n de una ‚Äòmoto bomba‚Äô en Samaniego, Nari√±o | Noticias RCN
text: Varios heridos tras la detonaci√≥n de una ‚Äòmoto bomba‚Äô en Samaniego, Nari√±o El atentado con explosivos que fueron adaptados a una motocicleta se present√≥ en el parque principal del municipio Samaniego. Noticias RCN 07:38 p. m. [Unirse al canal de Whatsapp de Noticias RCN](https://www.whatsapp.com/channel/0029VZzgtsp8PgsABlHj6g3K) En horas de la tarde del jueves 22 de agosto se report√≥ un atentado con explosivos en el casco central del municipio Samaniego, en [Nari√±o](/temas/narino). Una motocicleta fue adaptada con artefactos explosivos que fueron detonados en el parque principal. La informaci√≥n preliminar que se maneja de este nuevo ataque terrorista indica que varias personas resultaron heridas por la explosi√≥n. La explosi√≥n se registr√≥ en el parque Sol Andino, cerca de la estaci√≥n de Polic√≠a. Detalles de la explosi√≥n de ‚Äòmoto bomba‚Äô en Samaniego Las autoridades confirmaron que se trat√≥ de una moto acondicionada con explosivos en los alrededores del parque principal de la cabecera municipal de Samaniego. Primeras informaciones reportan varios heridos producto de la explosi√≥n. El hecho se present√≥ justo en inicio del concurso departamental de bandas musicales. Noticia en desarrollo‚Ä¶ M√°s informaci√≥n, en breve. author: Decatur Daily Democrat
title: WEF24: Saudi Ambassador to US says Kingdom prioritizing ‚Äòpeace and prosperity‚Äô policies | News | decaturdailydemocrat.com
text: Saudi Arabia is prioritizing peace and prosperity in its efforts to lead the Middle East towards stability and security amid ongoing geopolitical volatility in the region, the World Economic Forum (WEF) Annual Meeting 2024 heard today from Her Royal Highness Princess Reema Bandar Al-Saud, Ambassador of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia to the United States of America. This press release features multimedia. View the full release here: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20240118880673/en/ Saudi Ambassador to US says Kingdom prioritizing ‚Äòpeace and prosperity‚Äô policies at the World Economic Forum 2024 (Photo: AETOSWire) ‚ÄúThe Kingdom has not put normalization at the heart of its policy. It‚Äôs put peace and prosperity at the heart of its policy,‚Äù she said in a session on ‚ÄòSaudi Arabia: The Course Ahead‚Äô. HRH Princess Reema emphasized Saudi Arabia‚Äôs focus on the ‚ÄúPalestinian people who deserve a state, sovereignty, and a pathway that is irrevocable. That is how we get security. We carry peace, we carry prosperity, we carry safety, and we deliver it through the Palestinian statehood.‚Äù In the same session, His Excellency Adel A. Aljubeir, Saudi Arabia‚Äôs Minister of State for Foreign Affairs, Member of the Council of Ministers and Envoy for Climate, spoke of the need to address climate change scientifically, decoupled from emotions and hypocrisy. ‚ÄúThe world‚Äôs appetite for energy is unlimited. The additional increase of energy supplies has to come from non-oil resources,‚Äù Aljubeir said, noting that, ‚ÄúWe are saying we have a problem, and the problem has to do with climate change. And we need to tackle this problem in a serious, scientific manner. We need to deal with it without emotions, we need to deal with it without trying to score political points.‚Äù His Excellency Mohammed Aljadaan, Saudi Arabia‚Äôs Minister of Finance, emphasized that the Kingdom is determined to double down on what it is doing on its economy because the region and the world need a strong Saudi. Aljadaan highlighted that the Kingdom‚Äôs non-oil GDP is growing, unemployment is at the lowest level, and women's participation in the workforce has already surpassed the target set under the Saudi Vision 2030. In an earlier session on ‚ÄòMENA‚Äôs Economic Dilemma: Reforms Amid Uncertainty‚Äô, His Excellency Faisal F. Alibrahim, Saudi Arabia‚Äôs Minister of Economy and Planning, described the resilient nature of the region. He said the Middle East ‚Äúalways comes out of challenges as a better version of itself‚Äù adding that it has an opportunity to ‚Äúco-author the future of the global economy‚Äù. Alibrahim touched on national transformations, highlighting the importance of delivering ‚Äúconsistently with a boldness and a view to collaborate with the world. Vision 2030 is an evolution, a transformation that is taking us to where we want to be as an economy and society.‚Äù In the morning, a session on ‚ÄòOcean Regeneration Through Collaborative Innovation‚Äô explored approaches and solutions to environmental challenges. *Source: AETOSWire View source version on businesswire.com: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20240118880673/en/ Contacts Wooud Alquaied [walquaied@mep.gov.sa](mailto:walquaied@mep.gov.sa)
